conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.
The graph shows the vertical velocity of the skydiver over time.
The skydiver starts at a velocity of 20 m/s.

premise: The graph shows that the velocity increases linearly from 0 to 10 seconds.
conclusion: This indicates that the acceleration is constant during this interval.

premise: The slope of the line on the graph represents the acceleration.
conclusion: The slope of the line from 0 to 10 seconds is calculated as follows: Acceleration = (20 m/s - 0 m/s) / 10 s = 2 m/s²

premise: Since the acceleration is positive (2 m/s²),
conclusion: the direction of the acceleration is upward.
